Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Shabti
Description: Coarsely manufactured wooden shabti. The features are barely shown. Two strands of hair of a thick wig fall on the chest, the rest of the body bears no particular relief. The shabti appears to have been partly destroyed by fire, particularly on the right foot. The back is extremely deteriorated and crumbled: a large crack spreads from the lower part of the face to the foot.
